description:
Iammeter Solar PV System,
You can monitor the energy flow of the solar pv system.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "Homeassistant")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "chargesPV")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "puissance_consomme")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "inverter_power")

from(bucket: "Homeassistant")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "chargesPV")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "puissance_produite")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "inverter_power")

from(bucket: "Homeassistant")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "chargesPV")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "puissance_injectee")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "inverter_power")

from(bucket: "Homeassistant")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "chargesPV")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "puissance_reseau")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "inverter_power")

from(bucket: "Homeassistant")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "smart_meter_fronius")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "current_total")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "inverter_power")

from(bucket: "Homeassistant")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "smart_meter_fronius")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "current_A")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "inverter_power")

from(bucket: "Homeassistant")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "smart_meter_fronius")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "current_B")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "inverter_power")

from(bucket: "Homeassistant")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "smart_meter_fronius")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "current_C")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "inverter_power")

options.content:
By installing only one WEM3080T (three phase WiFi energy meter) in your single phase solar system, and clamping the first CT onto grid, the second CT onto solar inverter and the third CT onto load if applicable, you can monitor "Grid Consumption Energy" (the energy consumed from the grid), "Exported Energy" (the energy exported to the grid) and the energy produced by solar inverter. You can monitor the energy flow of the solar system.

Enjoy and have fun on Iammeter

title: Solar PV System
